New Records: Charlie Blackmon tied Carlos Gonzalez for the fifth in franchise history with his 227th career home run.
Ezequiel Tovar had his NL-leading 45th double of the season with a two-run game-tying double in the eighth inning.
Ryan McMahon had two hits and brought home Tovar with a double, contributing to the Rockies' win.
Key Match Events: Ezequiel Tovar's two-run, game-tying double in the eighth inning sparked a five-run rally.
Ryan McMahon's double to right field brought home Tovar for the winning run.
Pre-Game Insights: Charlie Blackmon mentioned the game's grinder nature and the team's resilience.
The Rockies needed to win two out of three games against the Dodgers to avoid a 100-loss season.
Post-Match Reflections: Charlie Blackmon expressed a desire to enjoy his final games and mentioned the team's potential.
St. Louis Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol acknowledged the loss but praised Fernandez's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lars Nootbaar had two hits and two RBIs, including his 11th home run of the season.
Paul Goldschmidt hit a 457-foot solo home run, snapping a 19-game homer drought.
Others: Charlie Blackmon's father threw out the ceremonial first pitch, a strike.
Ryan Feltner will start the Rockies' season finale against the Dodgers.
